text:
Now it was in the days of the judging of the judges
That there was a famine in the land.
And a man went from Bethlehem of Judah for sojourning in the fields of Moab; he and his wife and his two sons.

And the name of the man was Elimelek.
And the name of his wife was Naomi.
And the name of his two sons were Machlon and Kilyon.
They were Ephrathites from Bethlehem of Judah.
And they went to the fields of Moab, and they were there.

Now Elimelek, the husband of Naomi, died.
And she was left behind, she and her two sons.

And they took for themselves Moabite wives.
The name of the one was Orpah and the name of the other woman was Ruth.
And they dwelt there for ten years.

And they died also, the two of them, that is, Machlon and Kilyon.
And the woman was left behind from her two boys and from her husband.

And she arose, she and her daughters-in-law
And she returned from the fields of Moab.
For she had heard while in the fields of Moab that YHWH had visited his people in order to give them bread.

And she went out from the place where she was, with her two daughters-in-law.
And she went on the road to return to the land of Judah.

And Naomi said to her two daughters-in-law, 
“Go! Return, each of you, to the house of your mother.
May YHWH deal loving-kindness to you both, just as you have done with the dead and with me.

May YHWH grant that each of you may find rest in the house of a husband.”
And she kissed them, and they lifted up their voices
And they wept.
And they said to her, “We will return with you to your people.”

And Naomi said, 
“Go back my daughters. 
Why should you go with me? 
Do I still have sons in my womb? 
And could they be husbands to you?

Go back my daughters, go.
For I am too old to belong to a husband.
Even if I thought there was hope for me also to belong to a man tonight and also that I would give birth to sons…

Would you wait for them until they had grown?
Would you shut yourselves up for them, and never belong to a man?
No my daughters, for the bitterness which belongs to me is too much for you.
For the hand of YHWH has gone out against me.

And they lifted up their voices and they wept again.
And Orpah kissed her mother-in-law.
But Ruth clung to her.

And she said, “Behold, your sister-in-law went to her people and to her gods. 
Return after your sister-in-law.”

But Ruth said, 
“Do not entreat with me to leave you 
To turn back from following after you 
For where you go, I will go
And where you lodge, I will lodge
Your people will be my people
And your God will be my God

Where you die I will die
And there I will be buried.
Thus and more may YHWH do to me
If anything but death separates me and you.”

And she saw that she was determined to go with her
And she ceased speaking to her.

And they went, the two of them, until they came to Bethlehem.
And it came about when they arrived in Bethlehem, the whole city murmured about them.
And the women said, “Is this Naomi?”

But she said to them, 
“You must not call me Naomi.
Call me Mara.
For the Almighty has embittered me greatly.

I, even I, went away full
YHWH has made me return empty.
Why should you call me Naomi,
Since YHWH has opposed me 
And the Almighty has brought misfortune to me.

So Naomi returned, and Ruth the Moabite her daughter-in-law with her
The one who returned with her from the fields of Moab.
(Now they came to Bethlehem at the beginning of the harvest of barley).
